alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Real (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:00PM CDT until August 30 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bandera County in south central Texas... Southeastern Real County in south central Texas... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 600 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Portions of the warned area received up to 5 to 6.5 inches this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Medina, Bandera, Tarpley, Vanderpool, Hill Country State Natural Area and Lost Maples State Natural Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
